action.action-desc: Mr. Fry (for himself, Ms. Crockett, Mr. Norman, Mr. Finstad, Ms. Hageman, Mr. Donalds, Mrs. Houchin, Mr. Womack, Mr. Williams of Texas, and Mr. Timmons) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Accountability

form.official-title: To require transparency in notices of funding opportunity, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Grant Transparency Act of 2023.

subparagraph.text: has the meaning given the term Executive agency in section 105 of title 5, United States Code; and
does not include the Government Accountability Office.

paragraph.text: The term competitive grant means a discretionary award (as defined in section 200.1 of title 2, Code of Federal Regulations) awarded by an agency—

subparagraph.text: through a grant agreement or cooperative agreement under which the agency makes payment in cash or in kind to a recipient to carry out a public purpose authorized by law; and
the recipient of which is selected from a pool of applicants through the use of merit-based selection procedures for the purpose of allocating funds authorized under a grant program of the agency.

paragraph.text: The term evaluation or selection criteria means standards or principles for judging, evaluating, or selecting an application for a competitive grant.
The term notice of funding opportunity has the meaning given the term in section 200.1 of title 2, Code of Federal Regulations.

subparagraph.text: means a system of evaluation of competitive grant applications to determine how such applications advance through the selection process; and

clause.text: a methodology to evaluate and rate based on a point scale; and
an evaluation to determine whether a competitive grant application meets evaluation or selection criteria.

subsection.text: Each notice of funding opportunity issued by an agency for a competitive grant shall include—

paragraph.text: a description of any rating system and evaluation and selection criteria the agency uses to assess applications for the competitive grant;

a statement of whether the agency uses a weighted scoring method and a description of any weighted scoring method the agency uses for the competitive grant, including the amount by which the agency weights each criterion; and
any other qualitative or quantitative merit-based approach the agency uses to evaluate an application for the competitive grant.

subsection.text: With respect to a particular competitive grant, nothing in this Act shall be construed to supersede any requirement with respect to a notice of funding opportunity for the competitive grant in a law that authorizes the competitive grant.
No additional funds are authorized to be appropriated for the purpose of carrying out this Act.

paragraph.text: This Act shall take effect on the date that is 120 days after the date of enactment of this Act.
This Act shall not apply to a notice of funding opportunity issued before the date of enactment of this Act.
